definition: shield/(fig.) excuse
to arrange/to put in order
to resist/to obstruct/to hinder/to keep off/to block (a blow)/to get in the way of/cover/gear (e.g. in a car's transmission)
arrow/CL:支[zhi1]
mahjong tile/playing card/game pieces/signboard/plate/tablet/medal/CL:片[pian4],個|个[ge4],塊|块[kuai4]

sentences.english: The sovereignty of States must no longer be used as a shield for gross violations of human rights.
sentences.chinese: 國家主權不能再被用作嚴重侵犯人權的擋箭牌。

sentences.english: Looks like I got the teacher that move around to make the shield.
sentences.chinese: 看上去好像是拿了老師老子的那幾招過來做擋箭牌。

sentences.english: Such retreats behind barriers will only make the economic crisis worse.
sentences.chinese: 這種用壁壘作擋箭牌的做法只會加重經濟危機。

sentences.english: It was an accident; Jimmy used the kid as a shield.
sentences.chinese: 那是個意外，Jimmy用他兒子作擋箭牌。

sentences.english: She used my father and brother as tools to make me feel guilty.
sentences.chinese: 她把父親和哥哥當成擋箭牌好讓我有負罪感。
